p: Anhui Province, located in East China, has a total area of 139,600 km 2, a population of 60.8 million and GDP of the Province in 2015 was 2200.56 billion Yuan [ 22– 24]. It has a warm-temperate, semi-humid monsoonal climate with an average annual temperature between 14 and 17 °C, and precipitation between 800 and 1800 mm [ 22]. China’s largest and third largest rivers, Yangtze and Huai, run through the Province [ 22].
